Bash(git -c user.name="Claude Code" -c user.email="noreply@anthropic.com" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Implement feed management CRUD with HTMX-powered UI

Users can now manage their RSS feed subscriptions through an intuitive
web interface. This enables the core workflow of adding feeds they want
to follow and removing feeds they no longer need, which is essential
before implementing the RSS fetching functionality.

The implementation follows clean architecture principles with separated
layers for domain logic, data access, and HTTP handling. This makes the
codebase maintainable and testable as we add more features.

Feed management features:
- List all subscribed feeds with visual cards
- Add new feeds via modal form \(no page reload\)
- Delete feeds with HTMX confirmation dialog
- URL validation prevents invalid or duplicate feeds
- Cascading deletes remove associated articles

Technical implementation:
- Domain models with SQLx FromRow for type-safe queries
- Repository pattern for database operations
- Service layer with business logic and error handling
- Askama templates with compile-time checking
- HTMX for progressive enhancement \(forms/deletes inline\)
- AppState for shared database pool across handlers

The UI provides immediate feedback through HTMX partial updates rather
than full page reloads, creating a snappy user experience that aligns
with the project''s goal of being modern and responsive.
